  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    boolean concatThem​(java.lang.String str, int l, int client_id)
    Given that the client holds a write lock on the given indexed element of the server, the input string is concatenated at the given index.
    java.lang.String fetchElementRead​(int l, int client_id)
    Given that a read lock has been established, an element is returned to the client.
    java.lang.String fetchElementWrite​(int l, int client_id)
    Given that a write lock has been established, an element is returned to the client.
    void fillServerArray​(java.lang.String[] toCopy)
    Fills the array of the remote server from the input file
    int getArraySize()
    Returns the length of the array held in the server
    int getId()
    Returns the id of the client that is connected to the server
    void insertArrayElement​(int l, java.lang.String str)
    Inserts an element into the array at the given index
    static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)  
    java.lang.String printElement​(int l, int client_id)
    Returns an element to be printed to the client, given that a lock is held on that element.
    void releaseLock​(int l, int client_id)
    Releases the locks held on that element of the array by that client.
    boolean requestReadLock​(int l, int client_id)
    Requests a read lock for the client given that there is not already a read or write lock on that element.
    boolean requestWriteLock​(int l, int client_id)
    Requests a write lock for the client given that there is not already a read or write lock on that element.
    java.lang.String sayHello()
    Returns a hello message to the client when they connect.
    boolean WriteBackElement​(java.lang.String str, int l, int client_id)
    Given that there is a write lock established on the element of the server, the input string is written back to the server held array.
